intro: Fuchsia asplundii, commonly known as the Hawaiian fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Fuchsia asplundii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
